title: Problems Configuring Folders with Global Inbox
content:
I'm giving Thunderbird a try because I'm unhappy with spam filters and rules not working in Outlook. I am tired of checking all my spam every day, to be sure that a wanted email is placed there. I want my T-BIrd to receive all spam, and use T-BIrd's rules to then firmly isolate, or even delete, specific spam that I receive.

I've set up four email accounts, using a Global Inbox, so everything is together. While I had been using IMAP with Outlook, I understand I need to use Pop3 for this to work with Thunderbird, so I did that. But....

I am getting some emails with Thunderbird, but not all, even those addressed to me. Will leaving Outlook open during this transition period prevent T-Bird from working properly? Likewise, can gmail.com be open when trying to debug messages? I just sent myself a gmail message, which was received in Outlook, but not in T-Bird (and I couldn't find it in Gmail either, which is /really/ confusing).

Oh, shoot, I tried sending mail using my Gmail account from Thunderbird, and it failed. I went to look up Server settings for Gmail with T-Bird, and the article said I'd have to use IMAP, which I cannot use if I want to have the Global Inbox. So, is use of T-Bird dead for me, if I require/desire a Global inbox?

Of the emails I've received so far, only one is marked by T-Bird as Junk, which I can identify by the red color, and when I click on it, I have a "Not Junk" button. But there is no Junk folder, which is where I thought it would be.

Ostatní přílohy (např.xls) se zobrazí i s velikostí a následně je lze běžně přeposlat. Děkuji za radu. Jirka Špilar

title: Problema di formattazione
content:
Dopo aver aggiornato alla versione Supernova a fine settembre, riscontro ancora oggi problemi durante la formattazione del testo. Scegliendo tra le varie opzioni di formattazione del testo (grassetto, corsivo, elenco puntato, ecc.) il cursore si sposta all'inizio della riga e da quel punto inizia a scrivere e senza formattazione. Inoltre anche cliccando il tasto shift il comando non viene recepito e la parola inizia senza lettera maiuscola.

Chiedo inoltre la possibilità di inserire il comando di stampa SOLO PER TESTO SELEZIONATO. Ora procedo aprendo la email, clicco inoltra, seleziono la parte che mi interessa, e se il testo non è in una specifica formattazione, il comando stampa mi apre l'anteprima con il testo (anche solo 4 righe) diviso in 2 pagine. (VEDI ALLEGATO).

Ver. 115.4.1 (64 bit)

title: All My Mail Is Gone
content:
Last night, all of my Thunderbird mail disappeared. Thousands of messages.

I have 3 email addresses, each from a different server, one being Google.

I work on a Mac, Monterey version 12.6.1

Thunderbird is 115.4.1

The inbox for each of the 3 accounts says how many messages exist, but none are visible.

This morning, incoming mail is visible. But one of my test messages to myself disappeared a little while after I sent it.

I'm pretty devasted! I've used Thunderbird for more years than I can remember.

I've lost messages I need to refer to and templates for business.

I'm highly functuional on my laptop and with my email, but I'm not a tech person.

How can I recover my emails?

My work emails do exist on the server. But much of my gmail is no longer on the server.

Thanks for any help you can provide to a layperson like me!

~Ellen

title: Disable threads in Search Messages
content:
Hello,

I'm using Thunderbird since long time and I always configured it to do not thread messages. Now with the latest upgrade to 115.4.1 (32-bit) I see that the view in the main window is still with no thread (and I have an option do enable/disable such mode).

However when I do a search the list of resulting messages is threaded. The issue is that when I double click on one of them, multiple windows are opened, this is not only inconvenient (I have to close them one by one) but in some cases also cause cause performance issue, TB itself reports a warning "Opening 19 messages may be slow. Continue?".

How can I disable the threaded view in the search results ?

Thanks and best regards.

title: Thunderbird 115.4.1 Search Not Working Properly - Finds email, but then nothing!
content:
I have several accounts set up in Thunderbird. I click on one account and use the search feature (CTRL-K) to look for messages sent from a particular contact, "Kevin". Thunderbird shows a list of all messages that "mention" the name Kevin. I click on the contact in the list so that I can see all the email from the particular Kevin that I'm interested in. Thunderbird opens a new window with email previews of sent/received from that contact.

...But that's where it ends. I can't select any single email. Right-clicking the preview does nothing. I can't expand the preview to see the entire email. If I click the highlighted subject line link, Thunderbird opens yet another window which shows the subject line and "0 messages". There is no message text displayed. If I click "Show results as a list", Thunderbird opens a window with just one line which reads "Search 0 Messages". I can't even highlight the email address of that contact and copy/paste it into a new message!

This makes the Search function completely useless! I can see that messages from this contact exist, but I can't get to them without manually scrolling back through (maybe years of) messages to find the one I'm looking for.

What am I doing wrong... or is this a problem with Thunderbird?

title: connecting to CalDAV calendar and CardDAV contacts can't pull new SSL after renew
content:
Hello All,

I have a question about connecting to CalDAV calendar and CardDAV contacts. So it was working with no issue, until my SSL certificate expired. When The new SSL certificate installed the app still get the old expired one, even after deleting the expired one from the server. Clearing cache does not work. The issue is that when connecting, it get the old SSL certificate from somewhere other than the server. I have tried to connect using a different device and the connection was established with no issue. So defiantly the server is providing the correct SSL but the app is getting saved SSL from somewhere. Any advice?

title: Thunderbird 115, POP3 mail, and mail proxy
content:
A problem I experienced earlier with TB 102 has resurfaced with the upgrade to 115. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1409539 for reference.

The solution at that time was to create an entry mailnews.pop3.jsmodule and set its value to false. So, when the problem reappeared in 115, I opened the config editor, expecting to find that entry removed. Instead, the entry is still there, so the question now becomes (1) Is that preference completely ignored in TB 115, or (2) Is there another preference to change to allow TB to work once again with POP3 mail proxies?

If it matters, this installation is on Linux Mint Debian Edition 5 and the proxy is SpamBayes 1.1b3.

Images of the error message and the preference are uploaded.

Thanks, Dale
creator: dale35

title: Zapisywanie wiadomości "Zapisz jako ..." nie uwzględnia zaawansowanych uprawnień do folderu
content: Przy zmianie wersji z 102.14.0 na 115.3.1 zauważyłem zmianę w działaniu Thunderbirda. Thunderbird w wersji 115.3.1 przy zapisywaniu wiadomości "Zapisz jako ..." nie potrafi jej zapisać do folderu z ustawionymi uprawnieniami zaawansowanymi: "Tworzenie plików zapis danych" (bez uprawnienia "Tworzenie folderów/Dołączanie danych"). Prawdopodobnie stara się to zrobić w dwóch krokach: tworzy pusty plik (system zezwala) i następnie próbuje zmienić jego zawartość (system zabrania). W takiej konfiguracji zabezpieczeń Thunderbird w wersji 102.14.0 zapisuje wiadomości bez problemu. Nie wiem w której wersji Thunderbirda nastąpiła zmiana ale wydaje mi się, że tak zaimplementowana funkcjonalność to błąd implementacji. Czy istnieje sposób aby zmusić nowego Thunderbirda do zapisywania wiadomości tak jak w wersji np. 102.14.0?
creator: info10207

title: Thunderbird "Mbox All mail Including Spam and Trash-002.mbox larger than 4GB, skipping"
content:
I created a Google Takeout file for my emails in my old gmail account which I am trying to import into my new gmail account, however the system does not allow me to split the files into smaller sections say 2-4GB which is what Thunderbird supports. I tried to submit for a 2-4GB split for the Google Takeout files and no luck...it always comes out in 2 files, one is a few MBs and the second file is over 40GB.

As I am trying to use ImportExport NG tool in the Local folders Mbox import, I get an error of Mbox All mail Including Spam and Trash-002.mbox larger than 4GB, skipping.

I've tried to find some online MBOX splitting tools, however no success as the file is too big and causing issues.

Any help with be much appreciated.
creator: info10209

title: How do I turn off "chevrons"?
content: Recently (I am not sure what update started this) I started noticing "chevrons" in one particular folder under my inbox. How do I turn this unfeature off and get all emails as a new entry instead of the "chevron" method of hiding replies. This is very annoying and we need a way to turn this BAD idea off!
creator: white134098

title: Messages from senders in my address book end up in Junk.
content:
Messages from senders in my address book end up in Junk. I tell thunderbird they are not junk, but it immediately places them back in the Junk folder. This only happens on thunderbird 115.3.1 (64-bit) on red hat linux 8.8 When I run thunderbird on my macbook, this does not happen.

Here is the feedback I received previously:

> Check to see if spam/junk filters are being applied on the mail server before they reach TB. > > https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1404881
creator: t-pappas

title: email message list
content: I've been upgraded to 115, like it or not, and now my list of viewed email titles will only shorten to 10 emails instead of the previous 4, which leaves very little room to view an opened email. IOW, the double arrow will only let me raise the bottom boundary to be below a list of 10 emails. How can I shorten it back to 4??

title: Address Book

When I insert address in "email addresses" box, the box border turns red and the only option I have is to delete it. Same occurs if I want to edit an existing contact's email address. There is also a red - to the right of the "email addresses" box. Believe this has occured in the last week. Thanks, John
creator: courtney.john

title: right click not working right in mail
content:
I'm running t'bird 115.3.1 (64-bit) on Ubuntu 20.04. It seems to be a recent Thunderbird update since the screen has a different look. The problem has to do with right clicking. When I rt click on an email to delete it, the option dialog box pops up, but the cursor will not enter that area but stays in the left sidebar that lists the accounts and boxes. So when I hover the cursor arrow over "Delete message" and click, the click actually occurs in that left sidebar--i.e., it opens or otherwise affects one of those mailboxes listed there. (I can actually see the "selected" shadowing moving up and down the side bar as I move the cursor up and down in the email dialog box.) Restarting thunderbird doesn't help; rebooting Ubuntu does. But only for a little while, then the behavior reverts to the problematic behavior.

Any suggestions?
creator: firefoxeric

title: How do I put a "Not Junk" button in the menu?
content: Windows 7 64-bit Thunderbird 115.4.1 (32-bit) I put a Junk button in the menu, but I cannot find a "Not Junk" button in the Customize Toolbars dialog box.
creator: plowmail

title: thunderbird calendar
content: I have just spent a goodly while downloading Thunderbird and setting it up with my various email addresses. When I opened my main calendar, I was dismayed to see that all the entries had changed to a single colour. It was horrifying actually.... I hadn't realised how much I rely on the colours to tell me about my days! And - even more horrifying! - when I tried to find some function or other that would let me change the event colours, it wasn't there. I could get it to put a sliver of a different colour in a corner of the event, but that definitely isn't going to work for me. Why doesn't Thunderbird retain the colours that are already set up in Google calendar? Or is there a way to do this and I have just not found it?
creator: Peaches_57_x

title: moving a stack of emails from old inbox emails to thunderbird subfolders
content: My main inbox is getting too much emails and still show some from previous years that i would like to save, by moving to a thunderbird subfolder. I right click as suggested and it tells me to click "move' to subfolder of my choice, but it does not do so....why? I also tried to create another subfolder with a year as title and could not do it. I have the latest TB software.
